snippet: Administrators are accused of keeping low-performing students out of classrooms at test time to bolster schools’ scores.
abstract: School administrators in El Paso, Tex, are accused by federal prosecutors of keeping low-performing students out of classrooms at test time by improperly holding some back, accelerating others and preventing many from showing up for tests or enrolling in school at all; scheme is part of effort to inflate test scores to improve performance of struggling schools under No Child Left Behind Act.
lead_paragraph: Administrators are accused of keeping low-performing students out of classrooms at test time to bolster schools’ scores.

headline.seo: El Paso Rattled by Scandal of ‘Disappeared’ Students
headline.main: El Paso Schools Confront Scandal of Students Who ‘Disappeared’ at Test Time
headline.print_headline: El Paso Schools Confront Scandal of Students Who ‘Disappeared’ at Test Time
